DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location of the lung from which the specimen was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border._Relating to anatomy._A position within another named site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.:Relating to anatomy.:A position within another named site.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
Relating to anatomy.
A position within another named site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.value: Inferior segment of left upper lobe
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Inferior Segment Upper Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Inferior Segment Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In anatomy indicating lower than a given reference point.: One of the parts into which something naturally divides.: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

One of the parts into which something naturally divides.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

PermissibleValues.value: Carina between left upper lobe division and lingular
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Carina Between Upper Lobe of the Left Lung And Lingula of the Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Carina Between Upper Lobe of the Left Lung And Lingula of the Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A ridge or ridge-like structure.  In humans it usually refers to the trachea.  The carina of trachea is part of the lowest tracheal cartilage which is placed between the orifices of the two bronchi.: The space or interval separating two things.: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.

Concepts.definition: A ridge or ridge-like structure.  In humans it usually refers to the trachea.  The carina of trachea is part of the lowest tracheal cartilage which is placed between the orifices of the two bronchi.
The space or interval separating two things.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lingula of the Lung Segmental Bronchus

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lingula of the Lung Segmental Bronchus
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.: One of the divisions of the lobar bronchus that supplies a bronchopulmonary segment.

Concepts.definition: A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.
One of the divisions of the lobar bronchus that supplies a bronchopulmonary segment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

Concepts.definition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The superior segment of the inferior lobe of the right lung.
